About 90 percent of the Americans who need dialysis get it at a dialysis center.
It's a pretty passive experience.
They typically go in three days a week, and technicians connect them to machines that over a four hour period clean the toxins out of their blood that their kidneys no longer can.
LaClair says it pretty much kills a patient's whole day.
